text: Induction by glucocorticoids and enhancement by <extra_id_0> IFN-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and lipopolysaccharide .
<extra_id_0> Sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a macrophage - restricted member of the Ig superfamily that mediates adhesion with lymphoid and myeloid cells .
It is expressed on a subpopulation of macrophages in lymphoid tissues and in chronic inflammation ( e.g . , during autoimmune diseases ) .

We have studied the regulation of <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in vitro and show that glucocorticoids ( GC ) induce <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression on freshly isolated rat macrophages and the rat macrophage cell line R2 .

text: Northern blotting experiments indicated that regulation predominantly occurred at the mRNA level .

Comparison of the different combinations of GC and cytokines / LPS revealed differences in the level of GC - dependent enhancement of <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , with <extra_id_0> IFN-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> being more potent than <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LPS .

text: Moreover , the effects of <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and LPS could be reproduced by priming , whereas <extra_id_0> IFN-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were required simultaneously with GC .

The regulation of <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was mediated by the <extra_id_0> GC receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and not by <extra_id_0> mineralocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , as shown by inhibition experiments with specific antagonists .

text: Finally , it is demonstrated that macrophages in the adrenal gland , the major site of endogenous GC production , express <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

This study demonstrates that GC act as a primary inducer of <extra_id_0> sialoadhesin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression on rat macrophages , and that the response can be enhanced by <extra_id_0> IFN-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , T cell - derived cytokines , or LPS .
